Api Dashboardweb app

ReactJS

GitHub Repo Live version

The Api Dashboard is a web app built to call out to several RESTful APIs and build components from the results. It was built using several ReactJS techniques such as {useEffect, useState}, as well as Fetch Api, Luxon, and the Navigator Web Api. The homepage utilizes Flexbox heavily for the layout. It was built as as one of the projects for Scrimba's Frontend Developer Career Path.

This project was one of the more difficult but rewarding I have done. I had very little experience in fetching apis and with ReactJS unmounting and mounting components in development I had to learn to correctly make api calls only once, teaching me valuable lessons in having an isLoading state, holding data in localStorage, how to write better promises with catch methods.

Because on this project I have read and learned many of the advantage/disadvantages of axios and fetch api. I've put huge value on learning how to build custom hooks such as my go to useFetcher hook I have since built to handle many api calls without having to duplicate code.
